headline: snowfall warning in effect
description:
Snowfall with total amounts of about 15 cm is expected.

What:
Snowfall amounts near 15 cm. Lesser amounts are expected northwest of Kapuskasing to the community of Moosonee.
Peak snowfall rates of 2 to 5 cm.

When:
Late this morning into this evening.

Additional information:
Snow will fall heavily at times beginning later this morning before coming to an end this evening. Northwesterly winds gusting 50 to 60 km/h may result in local blowing snow.

###

Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
instruction: If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop. Take frequent breaks and avoid strain when clearing snow.
